snippet: State Department officials acknowledged that their efforts to directly challenge Boko Haram could prove challenging in a region racked by massacres, bombings and shootings.
abstract: State Dept is financing new 24-hour satellite television channel in turbulent northern region of Nigeria that is meant to provide alternative to violent propaganda and recruitment efforts by Boko Haram; move signals ramping up of American counterinsurgency efforts to directly challenge the radical group; channel, known as Arewa24, will provide original content produced by Nigerians, including comedies and children’s programs.
lead_paragraph: State Department officials acknowledged that their efforts to directly challenge Boko Haram could prove challenging in a region racked by massacres, bombings and shootings.

headline.seo: State Department Ramps Up Efforts Against Boko Haram
headline.main: Nigerian Television Becomes Front for U.S. in Terrorism Fight
headline.print_headline: Nigerian Television Becomes Front for U.S. in Terrorism Fight
